```{r setup, include=FALSE}
               rethinking,

```

```{r}
d <- read_csv("d.csv")

#Formula model 1
Formula1 <- bf(IA_swb10 ~ materialism + (1|ID))

#Formula model 2
Formula2 <- bf(IA_swb10 ~ n_ads + (1 | ID))

#Formula model 3
Formula3 <- bf(IA_swb10 ~ materialism + n_ads + (1 | ID))

#Formula model 4
Formula4 <- bf(IA_swb10 ~ round + (1 | ID))

#getting priors
get_prior(Formula1, data = d, family = gaussian())
get_prior(Formula2, data = d, family = gaussian())
get_prior(Formula3, data = d, family = gaussian())
get_prior(Formula4, data = d, family = gaussian())

#Setting priors model 1
Prior1 <- c(
  prior(normal(0.2, 0.1), class = Intercept),
  prior(normal(-0.1, 0.1), class = b),
  prior(normal(0.1, 0.2), class = sigma)
)

#Setting priors model 2
Prior2 <- c(
  prior(normal(0.2, 0.1), class = Intercept),
  prior(normal(-0.1, 0.1), class = b),
  prior(normal(0.1, 0.2), class = sigma)
)

#Priors model 3
Prior3 <- c(
  prior(normal(0.20, 0.005), class = Intercept),
  prior(normal(0, 0.01), class = b, coef = materialism),
  prior(normal(0, 0.01), class = b, coef = n_ads),
  prior(exponential(10), class = sigma)
)

#Setting priors model 4
Prior4 <- c(
  prior(normal(0.20, 0.01), class = Intercept),
  prior(normal(0, 0.005), class = b),
  prior(normal(0.5, 0.25), class = sigma)
)


#Model 1 prior only
A0_m1 <- brm(
  Formula1,
  data = d,
  family = gaussian(),
  prior = Prior1,
  sample_prior = "only",
  backend = "cmdstanr",
  chains = 2,
  core = 2,
  threads = threading(2)
)

#Model 1 
A1_m1 <- brm(
  Formula1,
  data = d,
  family = gaussian(),
  prior = Prior1,
  sample_prior = T,
  backend = "cmdstanr",
  chains = 2,
  core = 2,
  threads = threading(2)
)

#Summary of model
summary(A1_m1)

#PPchecks
pp_check(A0_m1, nsamples = 50 + xlim(0, 5))
pp_check(A1_m1, nsamples = 100)

#Model 2 prior only
A0_m2 <- brm(
  Formula2,
  data = d,
  family = gaussian(),
  prior = Prior2,
  sample_prior = "only",
  backend = "cmdstanr",
  chains = 2,
  core = 2,
  threads = threading(2)
)

#Model 2 
A1_m2 <- brm(
  Formula2,
  data = d,
  family = gaussian(),
  prior = Prior2,
  sample_prior = T,
  backend = "cmdstanr",
  chains = 2,
  core = 2,
  threads = threading(2)
)

#Summary of model
summary(A1_m2)

#PP plots prior and posterior model 2
pp_check(A0_m2, nsamples = 100)
pp_check(A1_m2, nsamples = 100)

#For the multiple regression I run the analysis on a smaller sample of the data
smalldf1 <- d %>% filter(as.numeric(ID) %% 4 == 0)
smalldf <- smalldf1 %>% filter(round %% 4 == 0)

#Model 3 prior only
A0_m3 <- brm(
  Formula3,
  data = smalldf,
  family = gaussian(),
  prior = Prior3,
  sample_prior = "only",
  control = list(
    adapt_delta = 0.9,
    max_treedepth = 15),
  chains = 2,
  core = 2,
  backend = "cmdstanr",
  threads = threading(2)
)

#Model 3
A0_m3 <- brm(
  Formula3,
  data = smalldf,
  family = gaussian(),
  prior = Prior3,
  sample_prior = T,
  control = list(
    adapt_delta = 0.9,
    max_treedepth = 15),
  chains = 2,
  core = 2,
  backend = "cmdstanr",
  threads = threading(2)
)

#Summary of model 3
summary(A1_m3)

#PP plots
pp_check(A0_m3, nsamples = 100)
pp_check(A1_m3, nsamples = 100)

#Model 4 prior only
A0_m4 <- brm(
  Formula4,
  data = smalldf,
  family = gaussian(),
  prior = Prior4,
  sample_prior = "only",
  backend = "cmdstanr",
  control = list(
    adapt_delta = 0.9,
    max_treedepth = 15),
  chains = 2,
  cores = 4,
  threads = threading(4)
)

#Model 4
A1_m4 <- brm(
  Formula4,
  data = smalldf,
  family = gaussian(),
  prior = Prior4,
  sample_prior = T,
  backend = "cmdstanr",
  control = list(
    adapt_delta = 0.9,
    max_treedepth = 15),
  chains = 2,
  cores = 4,
  threads = threading(4)
)

#Summary of model 4
summary(A1_m4)

#PP plots
pp_check(A0_m4, nsamples = 100)
pp_check(A1_m4, nsamples = 100)
```
